title: Harmonic Maass form
summary: In mathematics, a weak Maass form is a smooth function f {\displaystyle f} on the upper half plane, transforming like a modular form under the action of the modular group, being an eigenfunction of the corresponding hyperbolic Laplace operator, and having at most linear exponential growth at the cusps. If the eigenvalue of f {\displaystyle f} under the Laplacian is zero, then f {\displaystyle f} is called a harmonic weak Maass form, or briefly a harmonic Maass form.
